page.title: 20Glastonbury -Clubs/societies
page.content: There are many and varied clubs and assoiations to which townsfolk may become affiliated. {Sporting activities}include the following: angling, cricket, football, hockey, judo, netball, rugby and tennis. The public houses run skittle teams. {Youth groups}include Brownies/Guides, Cubs/Scouts/Venture Scouts and a newly formed Beaver group. There are Air Training Corps and Army Cadet Units. {Other pursuits}embrace cage-bird and bee-keeping and carnival clubs. {The Town Band}gives regular concerts and aims to promote a lively interest in brass instrument playing. The {Glastonbury Male Voice Choir}give many performances in aid of charity. Shows are produced annually by{Glastonbury and{Street Musical Comedy Society,}and staged in Strode Theatre,Street.
